snippet: After he jabbed himself with a needle last year on an Ebola ward in Sierra Leone, Dr. Lewis Rubinson became the first person to receive an experimental vaccine.
abstract: Dr Lewis Rubinson, who was given experimental Ebola vaccine after accidentally jabbing himself with needle in 2014 in Ebola ward in Sierra Leone, describes case in article and editorial published in JAMA; blood tests later found no evidence that he had ever been infected with Ebola.
lead_paragraph: After he jabbed himself with a needle last year on an Ebola ward in Sierra Leone, Dr. Lewis Rubinson became the first person to receive an experimental vaccine.

headline.main: A Mishap Sheds Light on an Ebola Vaccine
headline.print_headline: A Mishap Sheds Light on an Ebola Vaccine

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
